sub_title: Interdisciplinairy Expert (PhD) Tropical Forest Cultures and Landscapes
summary:
Currently seeking new opportunities in research, academia, government or private sector, for applying my holistic expertise in Anthropology/Archaeology, Heritage, and Historical Ecology (dynamics of coupled Natural and Human systems) with a regional expertise on Amazonia (incl. the Guianas) and interest in Melanesia (incl. PNG).

Education (PhD): All four subfields of Anthropology
(Socio-Cultural Anthropology, Archaeology, Biological Anthropology, Linguistic Anthropology)

Since 1996, Dr. Renzo Duin explores the entanglement of Things, Places, and Peoples of the Eastern Guiana Highlands (northern Brazil and southern Suriname and French Guiana), and how the materiality of performance contributes to self-identification and the legitimization of power, including gaining insight in the materialization of ritual performance and the role thereof in the socio-political landscapes of indigenous tropical forest cultures.
